summary: DHS gives agencies cybersecurity tools that identify the hardware and software on their networks and check for vulnerabilities and insecure configurations. We reviewed how 3 agencies—the Federal Aviation Administration, Indian Health Service, and the Small Business Administration—used these tools. These agencies' hardware inventories were missing information and contained duplicates. For example, one agency's tools provided at least 2 identifiers for about 40% of the hardware...
title: Cybersecurity: DHS and Selected Agencies Need to Address Shortcomings in Implementation of Network Monitoring Program
